block.p: Ogilvy One Worldwide in New York, part of the Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide unit of the WPP Group, acquired the Lacek Group, a relationship marketing agency with offices in Minneapolis; Singapore; and Seoul, South Korea, from Electronic Data Systems in Plano, Tex. Lacek, with 120 employees and revenue estimated at $18 million from clients like Starwood Hotels and Resorts, will become a unit of Ogilvy One.

And Octagon Worldwide in London and New York, a global sports marketing and entertainment agency that is part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, is acquiring a majority stake in Consultants in Sport in Brussels; Maastricht, the Netherlands; and Amsterdam.

The unit, to be called Octagon CIS, has 40 employees and billings estimated at $25 million from clients like Nike and Unilever. It will operate as an autonomous division of the Octagon Marketing unit of Octagon.
